title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. The amendment includes changes to the expected family contribution and grant amounts. Additionally, $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants by $1,050 for award year 2007-2008, totaling $4,331,000,000 in appropriations. The amendments will take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for interest on education loans is increased to $3,750. The phaseout limits are also raised to $75,000 for individuals and $150,000 for joint filers. Additionally, there will be annual cost-of-living adjustments to these limits starting from 2007. The amendments made by this section increase the deduction for interest on education loans to $3,750 and adjust the phaseout limits. The changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006 and repeal the sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 for certain provisions related to student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. Increases allowable contributions to Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. Repeals sunset provision for modifications to education individual retirement accounts. SEC. 5. Repeals sunset provision for employer-provided educational assistance. Repeal of sunset provision for employer-provided educational assistance under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001.
